alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 22 at 9:19AM MST until December 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...In Colorado, Yuma County. In Nebraska, Dundy, Hitchcock and Red Willow Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM MST /noon CST/ Friday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Friday. * IMPACTS...Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
